ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a deep insight into the topic of my choice, and I also gained valuable experience in writing a sustained, long-form paper.
How to conduct a long-term independent essay  project
I learned to write an extended English essay of 30+ pages. In doing this, I developed my ability to engage with literary criticism in my analysis and I improved stylistically as an essay writer.
I had the opportunity to pursue my own interests within the English major, writing an extended essay from my own research and literary analysis.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: You get to pick a topic you're passionate about, then read and write about it for an entire semester. It's kind of magical. The support from the English department is fantastic. As a person that likes to work at their own pace, I also liked that the classes/discussion sections are optional. 
Weaknesses: None.
The strengths were all of the deadlines to keep us on track and the supportive faculty! I felt supported by the graduate student and faculty member over the program as well as my own advisor.

Great support and feedback from our instructors! I loved checking in (and commiserating) with other students during group meetings. I do wish we had received more guidance on how to begin the project during winter break.

The strengths are that you get to write an English paper and conduct independent research on a topic of your choosing. I also loved getting to meet one-on-one with my adviser and discuss an area of their expertise with them. Although it was nice that the weekly meetings and workshops were optional for the most part, it would have been great if they were compulsory so we could have built more of a community among other thesis writers. Professor Glaser and Chris were also huge strengths as they were so generous with their time and gave excellent feedback on our drafts.

I thought this was a wonderfully structured approach to writing a Senior Essay--I greatly appreciated the scattered deadlines that incentivized me to write consistently and not save everything to the last minute (as I have often done). I enjoyed the weekly meetings with fellow essayists as a way to discuss ideas and keep up to pace with the group. Overall the structure of the writing process made for a much more pleasant experience!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you have a work in mind that you are passionate about, I would absolutely recommend this course as a capstone to your time in the English major. It's demanding especially as the later deadlines approach, but it is also extremely fulfilling.

If youd like to pursue a topic outside of the senior seminars being taught one semester, Id highly recommend this course. My writing improved tremendously, and I enjoyed getting to know many other people in the major.
Yes; writing a senior essay is hard, but its worth it!
Absolutely, if you are prepared to undertake a large-scale independent essay project.

Yes, definitely take this course! It's such a great way to end one's Yale English career and to study something you are truly passionate about. I also grew so much as a writer and thinker so I'd highly recommend writing the Senior Essay outside of a seminar even if you're not sure what exactly you want to write about. The process itself and the weekly group meetings make it worth it!
Yes! The senior thesis is an extremely rewarding experience, especially if you choose a topic you are passionate about, find an advisor who is willing to spend time to work with you, and start early.
The workload of a Senior essay is of course demanding, but if you're up for the challenge it was a great experience in pursuing my own passions and getting to hone my academic writing skills!
